message: I presented Mr. Thomas P Horvath with a Congressional Veteran Commendation for his courageous service to our country with the U.S. Coast Guard. Many thanks to Mr. Horvath's family for joining us to celebrate this very special occasion.
NA

We have a once-in-a-generation opportunity to fix our broken tax code and enhance American competitiveness for generations to come. I’m honored to serve as Committee on Ways and Means Tax Policy Chairman and look forward to putting it to good use shepherding tax reform across the finish line.

I presented Trisha Prabhu of Naperville with an Extension of Remarks to recognize her leadership combating cyberbulling. She developed an app called ReThink to provide users with an extra opportunity to edit or cancel text messages before sending. The popularity of the app continues to grow, as thousands have already downloaded it.

Are you coming to D.C. for #MarchForLife next week? You're invited to the Illinois Delegation reception. Please join us Friday, 1/27 from 10am to 12:30pm in room 1310 of the Longworth House Office Building.

I’ve heard from thousands of constituents over the past few years of the devastating effects #Obamacare has had on their lives and livelihoods. We have fewer choices and higher costs. In Illinois, insurance premiums have increased by an average of over 21%. More than 49,000 Illinoisans lost coverage when the Land of Lincoln Co-Op failed last year, leaving taxpayers on the hook for over $160 million. It’s clear the law has failed. Today we began the process to repeal and replace Obamacare with a patient-centered, market-based alternative to bring down costs and provide greater access to affordable care for all Americans.
I'll be delivering a major speech on #TaxReform tomorrow at The Heritage Foundation. Please join us in person or watch live at heritage.org

Thank you to everyone who stopped by our open house during Inauguration weekend. I'm glad so many Illinoisans had the opportunity to witness history. Please let my office know if you ever plan to visit D.C. You can schedule a meeting at https://roskam.house.gov/scheduling
It's National #SchoolChoice Week. Glad to see so many events across Illinois. School Choice empowers students, parents, and local leaders to provide more opportunities for all.
I spoke with Varney & Co. live from the GOP retreat in Philadelphia to talk about our plan to fix our broken tax code.
NA

Russian attempts to infiltrate and undermine democratic institutions across the western world are of grave concern to me. I’ve led solidarity missions to Ukraine and Georgia and spent time with their diaspora communities in Illinois and across the United States. We must stand shoulder-to-shoulder with our friends and allies who suffer the consequences of Russian aggression and intimidation. I’m deeply troubled to learn former National Security Advisor Flynn misled the Vice President. He was fired – and deservedly so. In the coming days and weeks I will be looking into this matter more closely.
NA

I was extremely pleased to hear President Trump begin his remarks by forcefully condemning anti-Semitism and recent hate crimes around the country. Religious freedom is a cornerstone of our nation and the ability for all faiths to worship freely is sacred to our identity as Americans – no hateful acts of vandalism or violent threats can change that. This week we re-launched the Bipartisan Taskforce for Combating Anti-Semitism for the 115th Congress.  On health care, the President reaffirmed his commitment not just to repealing Obamacare, but to responsibly replacing it with a better plan to provide access to affordable care for everyone. It is clear Obamacare has failed. Illinois families are paying more money for fewer and fewer benefits. Insurance premiums have increased by an average of over 21%. Last year, the Land of Lincoln co-op became the 16th in the country to collapse, leaving 49,000 Illinoisans without any healthcare coverage at all and taxpayers on for hook for over $160 million. I’m committed to developing a replacement plan that brings down costs and provides greater access to affordable care for Illinois families.  President Trump talked about the perverse incentives currently built into our tax code. We literally reward companies for shipping jobs overseas and then bringing their products back to sell in the United States. That’s why the Ways & Means Committee has put forward a plan to repeal the “made in America” tax. It will put American companies on a level playing field with the rest of the world: everyone will pay the same tax rate when they sell their products in the U.S. I’m honored to serve as Ways & Means Tax Policy Chairman in the 115th Congress and look forward to working with the administration to overhaul our tax code later this year.  It was also encouraging to hear President Trump’s renewed commitment to national defense. This needs to be matched with a redoubling of our diplomatic efforts to support democracy and human rights abroad. Adversarial regimes such as Iran and Russia continue to threaten our allies – we must show them the true meaning of American resolve. I pressured the last administration to do more to support our friends resisting the rising tide of Russian and Iranian aggression. I intend to do the same with this one.  Finally, I’m glad to see increased support for our men and women in uniform. I wholeheartedly support the President’s renewed commitment to our veterans. Nobody is more deserving of our support and care than those who have fought and bled for our country on the battlefield.

Following through on our commitment to responsibly #RepealAndReplace #Obamacare, my colleagues and I are pleased to introduce the American Health Care Act. We’re presenting a plan to increase access to affordable, patient-focused health care for all.

I met with students from Downers Grove North High School during their visit to Washington. Over the course of our discussion we talked about making health care more affordable, fighting climate change, and improving our education system. I am extremely impressed with our future leaders' knowledge of current issues. Keep up your hard work!
Elizabeth and I had a great time at the Judd Kendall VFW Post 3873 Fish Fry in #Naperville last night.
Another great fish fry at American Legion Post 690 in #Palatine - thanks for inviting us!

I met with the DuPage Federation on Human Services Reform last week to learn more about the health care and human services safety net here in DuPage County. Thanks for the great work you do in our community.
Enjoyed spending some time at the #LakeZurich Business & Community Showcase this afternoon.
I dropped by the Naperville Area Chamber of Commerce monthly meet-up earlier this evening. It's always nice to chat with these local business leaders.
I held a round table discussion with mayors from throughout the 6th district. It is important that we work together to best serve our communities.
I introduced the Stop Taxing Death and Disability Act with Rep. Ron Kind, Congressman Ryan Costello, and Congresswoman Chellie Pingree today.

My office is now accepting submissions for the 2017 Congressional Art Competition. It's open to all High School students and the winner will receive a free trip to Washington, D.C. and have his/her artwork displayed in the U.S. Capitol for one year.
There's just one week left to enter the Congressional Art Competition. Be sure to get your submissions in by Friday, 4/28.
I hosted a Spring Break open house with my constituents. Thank you to everyone who came out.
I re-introduced the RESPECT Act with Rep. Joe Crowley to rein in asset forfeiture abuse. Looking forward to getting this important piece of legislation enacted into law this year.
Great to meet with some more Illinois families before their United States Capitol tours.

Last night's strike was a bold and decisive action against the war criminal Bashar al-Assad – but airstrikes alone will not solve the crisis in Syria. We need a comprehensive strategy to end the tyrannical reign of the Assad family and free the Syrian people from the grip of Iran and Russia. Moving forward, the Administration should work closely with Congress toward that end.
NA

Last week, I voted for the Financial CHOICE Act, which ensures that taxpayers are never again forced to bailout Wall Street and eliminates unnecessary regulation that has crippled smaller businesses.  Since the enactment of Dodd-Frank in 2010, 42 community banks and 106 credit unions in Illinois have closed. Although well-intentioned, the effects of Dodd-Frank were most harmful to the consumers it was designed to help.   The CHOICE Act holds Wall Street accountable with the toughest penalties in history for those who commit financial fraud and deception.  To learn more about the bill, please visit https://financialservices.house.gov/choice/.

Congratulations to Crystal Lake South High School for their exciting victory at the Illinois High School Association's Class 4A State Championship Baseball Game! I am extremely proud of their hard work!
I enjoyed meeting families from Wheaton and Hawthorn Woods, Illinois before their United States Capitol tour this morning. Thanks for sticking around to take a look at my map collection!

Did you know June is Alzheimer’s & Brain Awareness month?  More than 5 million Americans are currently living with Alzheimer’s and, without significant action, as many as 16 million Americans will have Alzheimer’s by 2050. To get out the word, please take a moment to share how you have been touched by Alzheimer's or why you are embracing the cause. I will share mine tomorrow. #ENDALZ.

Congratulations to Barrington High School for winning the Illinois High School Association's 3A State Championship Girl's Soccer Game. I am looking forward to seeing the hardware next time I am in town. Way to go Fillies!

I am deeply saddened by the shooting this morning in Alexandria, Virginia.  Elizabeth and I are praying for Rep. Steve Scalise, the Capitol Police, and all those involved.  I wish those harmed a speedy recovery and commend the bravery demonstrated by the Capitol Police and those who tended to the injured.  We are fortunate to live among the brave men and women in uniform who serve to keep us safe each and every day.

As you may know, Alzheimer’s is the most expensive disease in America and the nation’s sixth-leading cause of death. Although I had been aware of statistics like these for years, Alzheimer’s truly hit home when my friend, Bill Perkowitz developed Early-onset Alzheimer's. Personally, I got to know Bill on the sidelines of youth soccer games. When Bill was not with his family, he was most likely training to run his next marathon. Following a long battle with the disease, Bill passed away last year on December 15, 2016. Bill and others like him are the reason I am fighting to #ENDALZ once and for all! Here is a picture of Bill, his wife Cathy who is a dedicated advocate for the Alzheimer's Association, and two of his children.
Honored to receive the American Ambulance Association's Legislative Recognition Award!
Thank you St. Charles Chamber of Commerce for meeting with me to discuss the importance of pro growth tax reform.

I am proud to have voted for the Strengthening Career and Technical Education for the 21st Century Act. Career education programs are an efficient way to provide workers with the skills they need, and a vital element of a pro-growth economy. #CTE reauthorization will help more individuals build successful, fulfilling careers. #whyCTE   To learn more, please visit https://edworkforce.house.gov/cte/.
I had a lot of fun at the 3rd International Day of Yoga Grand Inaugural Ceremony this morning. Thank you to everyone who came out and made this a special day.
Great to catch up with some of our neighbors from Wheaton, Illinois during lunch today. Thanks for stopping by to say hello!

Great to meet "The Greenhouse Gals" from Lisle before their STEM eCYBERMISSION Competition. Their project covered the effects of composting and how it can help cut down on waste, nourish soil, and generate heat. I even learned some great tips for the compost pile in my back yard. #ecyber17

It was an honor to meet with Taylor and Bonnie from Crystal Lake, two dedicated activists for the Lupus Foundation of America. Lupus is one of the cruelest, most mysterious diseases on earth. It is difficult to diagnose, hard to live with, and a challenge to treat. Thank you for sharing your stories.
The House Committee on Ways and Means unanimously voted for my bill to end IRS forfeiture abuse and it is now on its way to the full House. Here is my opening statement from today's markup:

I traveled to Village of Fox River Grove for a tour of the flood damage from earlier this week. A special thank you to Village President Robert Nunamaker for leading the way. Also, thank you to all the volunteers for your hard work.

I visited Heat And Frost Insulators Local 17 for a tour of their state-of-the-art apprenticeship training facility and to discuss tax reform's impact on mechanical insulation. Thank you for having me!
Pleased to sit down with representatives from the National Wildlife Federation Action Fund to discuss the Great Lakes Restoration Initiative and its impact on the 6th district.
It was great to meet with the Paulsen family from Wheaton earlier today. Thank you for stopping by the office to say hello.

Many areas of the 6th district have experienced dangerous levels of flooding in the past week and parts of Lake and McHenry County have been hit especially hard. I have visited the areas that have been most affected by the severe weather and will continue to coordinate with local officials, governments, and disaster relief agencies from the affected areas.  I spoke on the House floor last week to praise the excellent work of the hundreds of volunteers and local leaders who have responded to the flooding with their time and effort.  Emergency Contact Information:  McHenry County Emergency Management Agency: 815-338-6400 Lake County Emergency Management Agency: 847-377-7100

Honored to meet Matthew, a bright young student from Bartlett. Matthew has type 1 diabetes and is in DC with the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation advocating for diabetes research. Proud of his work!  #JDFCC17 #T1D

I participated in a round table discussion on combating human trafficking. Joining me were members of the 16 different organizations around Chicagoland working to combat human trafficking. We must work together to end human trafficking once and for all.
I visited Saratoga Grove Retirement Living to discuss the American Health Care Act and it's impact on seniors. Thank you to everyone who participated in the discussion.

I visited Moldtronics in Downers Grove and toured their state of the art manufacturing facilities. Moldtronics has been supplying customers around the world with high quality plastic injection molded parts for over 50 years. Thank you for hosting me.

Thank you to all of our summer interns for their hard work over the last couple of months. Please visit https://roskam.house.gov/services/internships to apply and learn more about a congressional internship!

It was great to meet residents of Palatine, Illinois during their visit to D.C. for the Korean American Grassroots Conference last week. Thank you for taking time out of your busy schedule to discuss taxes, health care, and national security.
I visited The Birches Assisted Living center in Clarendon Hills, Illinois to discuss Social Security, Medicare, and many other important issues. Thank you for hosting me.
#Medicare Part D premiums are going down next year. That's good news for seniors. go.usa.gov/xREZn
Thank you the Geneva, IL - Chamber of Commerce, and St. Charles Chamber of Commerce for hosting me at yesterday's luncheon. The food was great and the questions were even better.
I visited the Sunrise Assisted living retirement home in Naperville, Illinois to discuss protecting #SocialSecurity and #Medicare for future generations. Thank you for hosting me.

I hosted a round table discussion with #veterans of Naperville, Illinois at Judd Kendall VFW Post 3873. We talked about ways to improve the Veterans Health Administration (VHA) - U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs and make sure it works for all of our veterans.

Congratulations to Nick Macius, Travis Nix, Jake Kolar, Will Hendrichs, and Patrick Query on being named 2017 Illinois State Society of Washington, DC scholarship award winners. I am proud that each of you represent the state of Illinois.
I was pleased to join Glen Ellyn Police Department for the grand opening of their new station. A special thank you to all of the officers for their dedicated service.
Congratulations to the participants and volunteers of yesterday's #aquathon in Crystal Lake, Illinois. I am proud to represent your great community in the United States House of Representatives!

I participated in a round table discussion with mayors from around Illinois' 6th congressional district. We discussed infrastructure funding and the flood clean up currently under way in McHenry and Lake County. Thanks to Village of Barrington Board President Karen Darch for hosting us in her beautiful city.
I visited The Garlands of Barrington for a discussion on health care legislation and it's impact on seniors. Thank you for hosting a great event.

I visited the Hawthorn Woods, Illinois Park District to participate in a round table discussion on parks and recreation. I was joined by representatives from park districts around Illinois' 6th congressional district such as Crystal Lake Park District and more. We discussed the importance of supporting the Great Lakes Restoration Initiative and ways we can work together to improve our communities. Thank you to everyone who participated.

I had a great time at today's lunch with district office summer interns. Thank you to all of the interns for their hard work over the last couple of months. Please visit https://roskam.house.gov/services/internships to apply and learn more about Congressional internship. Interns can apply to work in Washington, District of Columbia or the West Chicago, Illinois district office.

Congratulations to Carol Stream, Illinois for being named to NeighborhoodScout's list of America's 100 safest cities. Working together, law enforcement, local officials, and the community have made Carol Stream a safer place to live, work, and raise a family. It was a true honor to commemorate this special achievement and present Mayor Saverino and the Carol Stream Police Department with an entry into the Congressional record on their behalf.

Today I met with Lionel from Lombard, Illinois. Lionel is a veteran of World War II and served in four theaters of conflict and the Battle of the Bulge. Unfortunately, Lionel faced complications in receiving the benefits he was owed from the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs. My office was able to assist in resolving the issue and Lionel is now receiving full pay from the VA. Constituents needing assistance with a personal problem with the Department of Veterans Affairs or other federal agencies such as the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, and the Social Security Administration can contact my office at 630-232-0006 to speak to a staff member. While I cannot override the decisions made by a federal agency, I can often intervene on a person's behalf to answer questions, find solutions, or just cut through the red tape. #CaseworkSuccessStory #CaseClosed

I visited the Northern Illinois Food Bank to discuss serving our hungry neighbors. We talked about importance of protecting #SNAP and #TEFAP. The Northern Illinois Food Bank is a true asset to our community. Thank you for all that you do!
I enjoyed meeting with farmers from Illinois' 6th congressional district today. Thanks to Illinois Farm Bureau for participating.

This morning I had a great visit with Mike, owner of Afterthought Brewing Company in Lombard, Illinois. It was encouraging to tour one of the many thriving small businesses that are opening up across Illinois' 6th congressional district. My office was able to assist his business in receiving their federal brewer’s license from the The U.S. Department of the Treasury. Constituents needing assistance with a personal problem with the Department of Treasury or other federal agencies can contact my office at 630-232-0006 to speak to a staff member. While I cannot override the decisions made by a federal agency, I can often intervene on a person's behalf to answer questions, find solutions, or just cut through the red tape. #CaseworkSuccessStory #CaseClosed

We must reject and denounce the heinous views on display in Charlottesville today. White Supremacists, Neo Nazis and the KKK do not represent American values. We are One Nation Under God and together we must reject bigotry and hatred here and abroad.
Congratulations to Hinsdale Little League on a great run in the Little League World Series.
Thank you to the 2017 summer intern class for making this summer a memorable one. To apply and learn about our office's internship program please visit https://roskam.house.gov/services/internships.

Congratulations to Lombard, Illinois resident Anna Ciamarra on raising over $6000 for childhood cancer research. This year she was chosen as one of Alex's Lemonade Stand Foundation's National Lemonade Days Hero Ambassadors. Please join me in honoring and celebrating Anna's generosity and strength.

Thank you SEASPAR for hosting me for a thoughtful and productive discussion. SEASPAR (the South East Association for Special Parks And Recreation) is located in Downers Grove, Illinois and provides services for individuals of all ages with all types of disabilities.

I had a great visit with Core Pipe in Carol Stream, Illinois. Core Pipe is like many businesses around our district. It is family-owned, hardworking, and growing. Unfortunately their success sometimes makes them a target for hackers and internet crime. After a hacker stole funds from Core Pipe, my office was able to assist Core Pipe with their case with the FBI – Federal Bureau of Investigation. Today, most of the money has been returned. Constituents or businesses that need assistance with federal agencies are encouraged to contact my district office at 630-232-0006 to speak to a staff member. #CaseworkSuccessStory #CaseClosed

President must not allow Neo-Nazis, White Supremacists or Klansman any refuge in his statements. Their views are unequivocally repugnant & have no place in our public square. Our nation, while challenged, is full of promise as we work to heal our republic.

I visited the Chicago Prostate Cancer Center in Westmont, Illinois. Thank you for hosting me for a great discussion.

I enjoyed meeting with volunteers and employees at Administer Justice in South Elgin, Illinois. We discussed tax reform, minimum wage, and immigration. Administer Justice provides free services like legal assistance to low income individuals and families. Thank you to Administer Justice for your service.
I was pleased to join Dr. Patel, his family, and Mayor Kownick for a ribbon-cutting ceremony at Cary Family Dental in Cary, Illinois. Thank you for inviting me!
I was pleased to meet with the Epilepsy Foundation of Greater Chicago. #EpilepsyChicago

Congratulations to Bartlett, Illinois for being named to NeighborhoodScout's list of America's 100 safest cities. It was a true honor to commemorate this special achievement and enter remarks into the Congressional Record on behalf of Mayor Wallace and the Bartlett Police Department.

I visited On Angels Wings Inc in Crystal Lake, Illinois. There are over 100 volunteers at On Angels Wings Inc., and I spoke to some of them during my visit. We discussed animal shelters, pet adoption, and other animal issues. Thank you for hosting me.
Thank you Saratoga Grove Retirement Living!

I had a great time at the West Chicago, Illinois Inaugural Back to School Day. Thank you to Mayor Pineda and the DuPage Airport Flight Center for hosting a fun event. My office offers a variety of educational resources and services to students, parents, and teachers. For more information, please visit https://roskam.house.gov/services/students or contact my office at 630-221-0006. Here is to a great school year!

Congratulations to Jeff Turner of Elgin, Illinois for being named the recipient of the 75th Cosmopolitan Club of Elgin Distinguished Service Award. I recognized Jeff by making an entry into the Congressional Record on his behalf. Thank you to the Elgin City Council Meeting for hosting a great event.

I visited the Fabricators & Manufacturers Association in Elgin, Illinois. We had a productive discussion about tax reform and the impact it will have on metal processing, forming, and fabricating industries. Thanks to everyone who participated.
I attended the University of Illinois Alumni Association's breakfast with Illinois Connection; the advocacy network for the University of Illinois.
Thank you Jeff Turner.
NA

Congratulations to Laura, a senior at Barrington High School for achieving the Girl Scouts Gold Award.   Laura’s project was named “Native Bird Houses”. This project addressed the inadequate number of shelters for native bird species in her local community. She worked tirelessly, with help from several volunteers, to create different types of bird houses, while educating members of the public on how habitat destruction and invasive species can severely impact the ecosystem. At last count, Laura built 38 birdhouses that will help maintain the avian community at Crabtree Nature Center in Barrington, Illinois.  Let's wish her well as she continues to make an impact with the Girl Scouts.

I visited Coalition Banquet Hall in Palatine, Illinois for lunch hosted by the Palatine Area Chamber of Commerce. I was joined by over 120 people from 9 Chambers throughout Illinois' 6th congressional district, including: Algonquin/Lake in the Hills Chamber of Commerce, Barrington Area Chamber of Commerce (BACC), Carol Stream Chamber, Glen Ellyn IL Chamber of Commerce, Rolling Meadows Chamber of Commerce, Lake Zurich Area Chamber of Commerce, Wheaton Chamber of Commerce, and Hoffman Estates Chamber of Commerce & Industry. We discussed the importance of a pro-growth tax reform. Thank you for hosting me.

I visited the The Reagan Ranch in Santa Barbara, California on the 31st anniversary of the single largest reform of the U.S. tax code in our nation’s history. I spoke about how pro-growth tax reform will help people reach the American Dream. I was joined by the Committee on Ways and Means and Rep. Kevin Brady.

I visited the The Reagan Ranch in Santa Barbara, California for a Committee on Ways and Means tax reform event. I spoke about how pro-growth tax reform will help people reach the American Dream. Thanks to the Committee on Ways and Means.

I visited Ivy Restaurant in Wheaton, Illinois for a breakfast hosted by the University of Illinois Alumni Association. We discussed higher-ed tax provisions, healthcare, and experiences from our time on the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign campus. I L L
I visited the King-Bruwaert House in Burr Ridge, Illinois to discuss protecting #Medicare and #SocialSecurity. Thanks to everyone who joined the discussion.

I visited the Robert Crown Center for Health Education in Hinsdale, Illinois for round table discussion on combating the opioid epidemic in Illinois. Thank you A Man In Recovery Foundation, DuPage County Health Department, Tools For Life Counseling and more for participating.    Did you know that 4 out of 5 heroin addicts start out with prescription pills?   #OpioidAddiction #Rally4Recovery #DuPageHealth

I visited the Robert Crown Center for Health Education in Hinsdale, Illinois for a round table discussion on combating the #opioidaddiction in Illinois. Thank you DuPage County State's Attorney's Office, Cook County Coroner, and DuPage County Psychological Services for participating.  Did you know that arrests for heroin possession have doubled since 2013?  #opioidaddiction #Rally4Recovery

I visited Klein Hall CPAs in Aurora, Illinois for an Illinois Chamber of Commerce tax reform event. We discussed the importance of pro-growth tax reform and preserving the American dream. Thank you for hosting me.
I recently spoke with NBC Chicago's Mary Ann Ahern. Check out our conversation here.
I visited The Drake Hotel - Oak Brook to discuss tax reform with the Illinois Bankers Association.

"It was truly an honor and privilege to intern for Congressman Peter Roskam this summer in Washington D.C.  The spectacle that is the United States Congress is amazing to witness and a once-in-a-lifetime experience.  Through all the committee hearings and briefings, legislative business, policy analyses, Capitol Hill receptions and Presidential speeches, I could not have received a more eye-opening summer.  Congressman Roskam, a man of faith and integrity, reminded me that the government does not control we the people, but we the people control the government.  While interning on Capitol Hill, I gained invaluable and firsthand education on the process, structure and daily operations of the United States Federal Government. I met a great deal of prominent leaders in our nation today, among them, Paul Ryan, Marco Rubio, John McCain, Kevin McCarthy and Ben Sasse just to name a few.  I not only walked in the footsteps of today's leaders, but historical leaders as well. While freely flashing my intern badge and walking the halls of the United States Capitol Building, I could not help but be humbled and exhilarated by thinking about those who came before me: Men and women among the likes of George Washington, Abraham Lincoln, Jeanette Rankin, Rosa Parks, Franklin Delano Roosevelt, and Ronald Reagan.  I will be forever grateful for the opportunity Congressman Roskam bestowed upon me to help him serve the people of Illinois's 6th Congressional District. I recommend this internship to all students, regardless of race, creed, color, ethnicity, gender or political affiliation, for you will not be disappointed.  But most importantly, you will be reminded that out of many, we are one. E Pluribus Unum."  Jake Kolar  Naperville  Please visit https://roskam.house.gov/services/internships to apply for an internship in my office.  http://www.dailyherald.com/article/20170829/discuss/170828960/

I visited Park Place Banquets in Crystal Lake, Illinois for coffee with the Crystal Lake Chamber of Commerce. We discussed tax reform and its impact on Crystal Lake businesses. Thanks to the awesome Chamber President Mary Margaret Maule for hosting me!
Thank you Mayor Rodney Craig for your dedicated service to the Village of Hanover Park, Illinois.

Yesterday, the United States House of Representatives voted unanimously to pass my bill H.R.1843 - the Clyde-Hirsch-Sowers (RESPECT) Act.   The RESPECT Act is a big step toward delivering justice for victims of IRS abuse. It’s clear to everyone involved that the IRS and DOJ abused their authority and took money from people who did nothing wrong. With this legislation, we’re making sure they can never do it again. I want to thank the Clyde, Hirsch, Sowers, and Taylor families for their bravery and willingness to share their stories in the hopes of preventing future injustice. I appreciate the support of Congressman John Lewis, Rep. Joe Crowley and the Committee on Ways and Means on this bipartisan bill. I’m glad we can finally put this ugly chapter to rest.  https://roskam.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/house-votes-unanimously-end-irs-forfeiture-abuse
NA
Yesterday, I met with General Stanley McChrystal and Service Year. We discussed strategies to strengthen the connection between service years and postsecondary education.
AG Sessions gives laminated hall pass for abusive bureaucrats. Did Loretta Lynch ever clear out her desk?
I visited Lazarus House in Saint Charles, Illinois.
I am speaking live at the Oak Brook Police Department 9/11 Memorial Service.
NA
I met with Philip and Victor, veterans from Illinois. We discussed veterans’ healthcare and military quality of life. Thanks to all of our veterans for their dedicated service.
I am proud to #GoOrange with the Northern Illinois Food Bank during #StopHungerWeek. The Northern Illinois Food Bank serves more than 71,500 different people each week.  #ILHungerAction

Last week, I participated in a discussion on the importance of simplifying our tax code. Simplification will make sure everyone pays their fair share, save time, and instill trust so people can no longer game the system. Thank you to The Hill for hosting me.   Please listen to our discussion here: https://youtu.be/8HCDv_twewg
Thank you to all of our fall interns for their hard work this semester. Please visit https://roskam.house.gov/services/internships to apply and learn more about a congressional internship!
Today I met with advocates from NationalADAPT to discuss the Disability Integration Act (H.R. 2472) to ensure that people with disabilities are not forced into institutionalized care unwillingly.

Got to meet with local small businesses from my district to discuss how tax reform will impact them, their businesses and their families. Valuable insights that I will take back to Washington with me.
NA
Presenting medals posthumously to the family of one of our World War II heroes, Marshall B. Leven.

Thirty-one years ago today, Congress passed the Tax Reform Act of 1986 - this was the last major overhaul of our tax code. Today, our tax code has grown to more than 70,000 pages! Together with my colleagues in Congress, I am working to reform our tax code and give much-needed relief to middle-income families and small businesses!
I am live talking tax reform with After the Bell on Fox Business.
Fighting for tax reform for middle-income families and small businesses in my district and across the U.S. on the floor of the U.S. House of Representatives.
Honored to visit these great kids at Eastview Elementary School in my district to talk to them about how a bill becomes a law!

Today I introduced bipartisan legislation to put an end to the loophole which has allowed the despicable practice of animal fighting to continue throughout our U.S. territories. Cruelty to animals is not a form of entertainment, it is a criminal act and it puts humans and animals at risk. It's time to put an end to this heinous practice. It was a pleasure to work with The Humane Society of the United States on this important legislation.

Today I voted in favor of the CHAMPIONING HEALTHY KIDS ACT which passed the House on a bipartisan vote. This bill extends funding for our public health programs such as the Children's Health Insurance Program (CHIP) and Federally Qualified Health Centers. Programs like CHIP and our Health Centers provide vital care to our children and greater community.
On Thursday, the House introduced the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act to overhaul our nation’s tax code for the first time in 31 years.

Congratulations to Wheaton Christian Grammar School for being named a 2017 National Blue Ribbon school!   http://wheatonchristian.org/connections/news-around-campus/wcgs-named-2017-national-blue-ribbon-school/
Let's give Americans a tax code they deserve. https://youtu.be/Pt7y3ErzDf4
ICYMI: Rep. Rokam spoke with Bloomberg to discuss the progress of the tax reform bill.

Yesterday I had the honor of giving the keynote address for the Village of Barrington's Veterans Day celebration.   Across the nation, we pay tribute to the brave men and women who served our country.   Thank you, Veterans, for your selfless service and dedication to a grateful nation.

Honored to meet Kerry Hughes and her team who started the nonprofit, Harmony 4 Hope in Lake Zurich, Illinois. They are using music and storytelling to raise awareness about Rare Disease. #raredisease #H4H
“Who does the status quo benefit, Mr. Speaker? It benefits the few. It benefits the privileged. It benefits the folks at the top of the economic scale of things.”

Earlier today, the United States House of Representatives passed the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act, which will reform our tax code for the first time since the Chicago Bears were defending Super Bowl Champs. Please visit https://roskam.house.gov/tax-cuts-and-jobs-act to learn more.

I visited the Bohler-Uddeholm North America Corporation in Elgin, Illinois to discuss the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act's impact on international trade. Thank you to all employees who took time to share their thoughts.
Speaking with Tahman Bradley from WGN TV about the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act.

As many as 25,000 women and children in our area are forced into the commercial sex trade each year. Chicagoland is now the 5th largest location for human trafficking in the U.S.  To learn more about human trafficking and share your thoughts, please visit my website and sign up for my newsletter at https://roskam.house.gov/contact/newsletter.
Honored to present medals posthumously to the family of veteran and World War II hero, Cabell Payne.
Behind the scenes - on Sunday Morning Futures with Maria Bartiromo on FOX to talk about how this tax bill will help hardworking taxpayers.

Thank you to Sunday Morning Futures with Maria Bartiromo for having me on today to discuss the wonderful opportunity we have with this new tax plan to transform our outdated and overly complicated tax code into something that hardworking taxpayers deserve.   http://video.foxnews.com/v/5651825640001/?#sp=show-clips

This year, I was proud to host the Congressional App Challenge in my district and inspire students to learn computer science. Tonight I was honored to present the awards for 1st, 2nd and 3rd place to these bright young minds. Congratulations! The Congressional App Challenge #Congress4CS
We all have so much to be thankful for - what are you thankful for this year?
Happy Birthday, Illinois!! On December 3, 1818, Illinois joined the union. I am proud to represent the state of Illinois the people of the 6th Congressional District!

Visited with the Ethiopian community at St. Michaels this morning - I had the opportunity to speak to the congregation and enjoyed fellowshipping and getting to know members of the community afterward. Learned so much speaking with community leaders to understand their concerns and how I can best represent them in Washington.
Watch my speech on the House floor supporting a tax bill that benefits hardworking taxpayers in IL-06 and across the nation!
NA

This weekend I had the distinct honor of presenting the Congressional Veterans Commendation to Daphne Hitchins Matthews of Barrington. During her service, Captain Matthews served in combat zones as a surgical nurse and directed doctors, corpsmen and nursing staffs in new plastic surgery techniques. Since her retirement Captain Matthews has continued support for military and veterans organizations such as the American Legion Post 690 Palatine, the Sons of American Legion, Honor Flight and served as a member of the executive committee of the Veterans of Lake Barrington Shores. We are forever grateful for the service and sacrifice of Captain Matthews both as an active duty servicemember and as a veteran.
I truly enjoyed fellowshipping with the pastors and congregation of St. Mary's Coptic Orthodox Church in Palatine today. An wonderful group of kind-hearted and devoted people.
Wishing all those celebrating a Happy Hanukkah! Chag Sameach!
I joined with the American Red Cross to sign holiday cards for our service members, veterans and their families in the U.S. and abroad. #Thankyouforyourservice

Yesterday I gave an opening statement at the House-Senate Conference Committee in support of tax relief for hardworking, middle-income families across America. I'm excited to be a part of an historic movement to overhaul a broken tax code that has maintained a status quo that hurts American families. We are on a path to making tax relief a reality for MILLIONS of taxpayers who will see more of the money they earn in their take-home pay!
It was an honor to present a Congressional Veteran Commendation at American Legion Post 80 in Downers Grove, Illinois.

Today I voted to give American taxpayers real tax relief and reject a broken tax code that has hurt middle- and lower-income families for far too long. Earlier this year, Democrats in Illinois were complicit in shoving through a massive state income tax hike that hurt middle-income families; this bill not only gives those families the tax relief they deserve, but it also gives small business owners the relief they need to grow their businesses and create new jobs. Watch my speech on the floor of the House  earlier today.

Today I voted to reauthorize the Children’s Health Insurance Program (CHIP) through March 31, 2018. Earlier this year, I voted to reauthorize CHIP funding through 2022. Though the bill failed to pass the Senate, I am committed to working with my colleagues in Congress towards a long-term sollution for CHIP. Millions of children rely on this program and we must get this done.

Great news, Illinoisans - the President has signed into law the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act and we're just 10 days away from more jobs, fairer taxes and bigger paychecks for Americans across the country!  The increase in the standard deduction to $12,000 for individuals and $24,000 for married couples – nearly double the amounts available today – will protect far more of every paycheck from taxes and make tax filing dramatically easier for the American people.
Counting down the days until we have a new tax code that will help small businesses get ahead!
